ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: I drink because it is pleasurable.
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 100 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I drink because I like being high or intoxicated.
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 100 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I drink because it calms me down when I am stressed out.
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 100 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I drink because I feel abnormal when I don't drink.
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 100 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I drink because I concentrate better when I drink.
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 100 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I drink because when I stop, I feel bad (I am nervous, irritable, and I sleep poorly).
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 100 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I drink solely out of habit.
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 100 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: I wanted to see what would happen if I tried one drink
Notes: 0= Not At All Important; 10= Very Important

ElementDescription: I just felt tempted to drink out of the blue and went off to get a drink.
Notes: 0= Not At All Important; 10= Very Important

ElementDescription: Someone offered me a drink
Notes: 0= Not At All Important; 10= Very Important

ElementDescription: I felt angry or frustrated because of my relationship with someone else
Notes: 0= Not At All Important; 10= Very Important

ElementDescription: I was with others having a good time and we felt like getting drunk together
Notes: 0= Not At All Important; 10= Very Important

ElementDescription: I felt worried or tense about my relationship with someone else
Notes: 0= Not At All Important; 10= Very Important

ElementDescription: I felt ill or in pain but this was not due to withdrawal from alcohol
Notes: 0= Not At All Important; 10= Very Important

ElementDescription: I felt others were being critical of me
Notes: 0= Not At All Important; 10= Very Important

ElementDescription: I saw others drinking
Notes: 0= Not At All Important; 10= Very Important

ElementDescription: Any other reason?
I felt angry or frustrated, either with myself or because things were not going my way
Notes: 0= Not At All Important; 10= Very Important

ElementDescription: I felt bored
Notes: 0= Not At All Important; 10= Very Important

ElementDescription: I felt anxious or tense
Notes: 0= Not At All Important; 10= Very Important

ElementDescription: When I saw alcohol I just had to give in
Notes: 0= Not At All Important; 10= Very Important

ElementDescription: I felt sad
Notes: 0= Not At All Important; 10= Very Important

ElementDescription: I felt ill or in pain or uncomfortable because I wanted a drink.
Notes: 0= Not At All Important; 10= Very Important

ElementDescription: I was in a good mood and felt like getting high.
Notes: 0= Not At All Important; 10= Very Important

ElementDescription: session ID/screening ID
Visit name
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2

ElementDescription: Was the questionnaire administered during this visit?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes
